column5: Made it out from 2:30pm until dark with my 8 year old son straight out from Gilford. Fished in 12 fow and up to 20 fow.  The fish were everywhere but mostly in the 15-17 fow range. I kept only 7 keepers(8-9 inches long) and a few that were hooked to deep out of about 100 perch landed. Talked to a guy that was much farther out and said he caught about 45 keepers so the bigger fish are in 25 fow or more.  Shortly after 4pm a daredevil came across from Keswick on his Ski-doo, probably the first of the year. Again we didn't use minnows, just spoons and jigging Raps. Still slushy on top near shore but a solid 5-6 inches of black ice.
Great report Skud  Must of been fun catching all those.... one after the other... Congratulations and thanks for sharing Leechman
O i love perch fishing, i can't wait untill spring to go out to scugog to fish for perch!  Thanks for sharing!
Do you have a camera to go with these reports? LOL  Thanks for the report .

Does anyone have any recommendations to lure / bait for perch??? I just normally use either the classic worm, hook, n bobber, and jig n curly tail grub! But are there any other better choices I can try out?  PM me if you can, it would be greatly appreciated!

I only take pictures on sunny days Misfish. Here is a pic from last March, our last day of the Hardwater season out from Gilford that I didn't write a report on. This is my older Bro with my son Calvin.
Profisher25.  I will take a pic of some of my favourite baits for Perchin' and post them up in a new thread.
hey profisher try one of these and you'll have no problem catching perch on cook's
Great report!  wow...100 perch!   busy day!
He sure is grown eh Doug,your son that is.LOL  Those are the days I like the best.
